triples.name: GPT-4
triples.relevance: GPT-4 serves as the primary large language model evaluated for automated qualitative coding tasks in this study.

triples.name: Qualitative research
triples.relevance: The paper applies qualitative research methodologies and coding techniques to analyze educational datasets.

triples.name: Prompt engineering
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and evaluates three different prompt engineering strategies for improving GPT-4 performance on coding tasks.

triples.name: Zero-shot learning
triples.relevance: Zero-shot learning is one of the three prompt engineering strategies tested to code constructs without examples.

triples.name: Few-shot learning
triples.relevance: Few-shot learning is evaluated as a prompt engineering strategy, both with and without contextual information.

triples.name: Word embedding
triples.relevance: The paper explores embeddings as an alternative approach to improve coding performance by capturing semantic relationships.

triples.name: Inter-rater reliability
triples.relevance: Inter-rater agreement with human coders is used as the primary evaluation metric for assessing coding performance.

triples.name: Coding (social sciences)
triples.relevance: The paper proposes automated methods for qualitative coding, a fundamental technique in social science research.
